alert.note: Alert for Meigs; Rhea; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN RHEA...NORTHEASTERN MEIGS AND SOUTHWESTERN ROANE COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Decatur, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Decatur, Spring City, Peakland, Stinging Fork Falls State Park, Eagle Furnace, Grandview, Piney Falls State Park, and Ten Mile. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
